alert.note: Alert for Bayfield; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 7:10PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Bayfield, northeastern Washburn and northwestern Sawyer Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 710 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stone Lake, or 10 miles south of Hayward, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage and Little Round Lake around 725 PM CDT. Round Lake around 730 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Chippewa Flowage West, New Post and Chippewa Flowage East. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
